TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract WeakEventManager extends System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject
Public MustInherit Class WeakEventManager Inherits DispatcherObject

summary.span: 为在“弱事件模式”中使用的事件管理器提供基类。

span.span: Provides a base class for the event manager that is used in the *weak event pattern*.

summary.span: 管理器为也使用该模式的事件（或回调）添加和移除侦听器。

span.span: The manager adds and removes listeners for events (or callbacks) that also use the pattern.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当事件源具有独立于事件侦听器的对象生存期时，通常使用弱事件模式。You typically use the weak event pattern when the event source has an object lifetime that is independent of the event listeners. 使用 的中心事件调度功能，即使源对象仍然存在，也可以进行垃圾回收。Using the central event dispatching capability of a allows the listener's handlers to be garbage collected even if the source object persists. 与此相反，使用 `+=` 运算符的定期事件挂接会导致可能断开连接的源持有对侦听器的引用。By contrast, a regular event hookup using the `+=` operator causes the potentially disconnected source to hold a reference to the listeners. 这会阻止接收方及时进行垃圾回收。This prevents the receiver from being garbage collected in a timely fashion. 源和侦听器之间的生存期关系应使用弱事件模式的一种常见情况是处理来自数据绑定的更新事件。One common situation where the lifetime relationships between sources and listeners should use of the weak event pattern is the handling of update events coming from data bindings. 弱事件模式也可用于回调和常规事件。The weak event pattern can also be used for callbacks and regular events.

para.span: 有关自定义 的示例，请参阅[弱事件模式](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/weak-event-patterns.md)。

span.span: For an example of a custom , see [Weak Event Patterns](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/weak-event-patterns.md).

summary.span: 将正在托管的事件传送到每个侦听器。

span.span: Delivers the event being managed to each listener.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从事件处理程序中调用 方法，这些事件处理程序由子类的 和 实现添加或移除。Call the method from within the event handlers that are added or removed by the and implementations of subclasses. 如果在类的 `AddListener` 实现中调用 方法，则接收事件的侦听器列表将保留在基础集合中。If you call the method in your `AddListener` implementation of your class, the list of listeners receiving the event is kept in an underlying collection. （`AddListener` 不是接口或类协定的一部分。(`AddListener` is not part of an interface or class contract. `AddListener` 是你的管理器类的方法的建议名称，该类调用 并为事件添加弱事件模式侦听器。）`AddListener` is the suggested name for the method of your manager class that calls and adds weak event pattern listeners for the event.) 将侦听器添加到单个列表。 adds listeners to a single list. 如果经理实现为每个事件维护多个侦听器列表，请不要使用 或 。If your manager implementation maintains more than one list of listeners per event, do not use or . 相反，你的实现应创建自己的 实例，`AddListener` 应将侦听器添加到相应的列表，并且应通过调用 将事件传递到相应的侦听器列表。Instead, your implementation should create its own instances, `AddListener` should add listeners to the appropriate list, and events should be delivered to the appropriate listener list by calling .

summary.span: 将正在托管的事件传送到所提供列表中的每个侦听器。

span.span: Delivers the event being managed to each listener in the provided list.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果您的管理器实现基于事件数据中捕获的信息维护单独的侦听器列表，则此方法是必需的。This method is necessary if your manager implementation maintains separate listeners lists based on information that is captured in the event data. 如果使用此高级技术，则必须创建和维护单独的列表作为经理实现的一部分，并且必须提供向特定列表添加侦听器的方法。If you use this advanced technique, you must create and maintain the separate lists as part of your manager implementation, and you must provide a way to add listeners to a specific list. 侦听原始事件的处理程序实现必须遵循用于区分列表的条件，并且仅将事件传递到适当列表。Your handler implementation that listens to the raw event must act upon the condition that you use to differentiate the lists, and deliver the event only to the appropriate list or lists.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 实现使用其传递的 `managerType`调用此方法。 implementations call this method using their passed `managerType`. 然后，将返回的 用作可确定接收事件的区别，以及要调用的私有类处理程序。The returned is then used as the differentiator that determines which event was received, and which private class handler to invoke.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 派生类可以选择要存储在此索引器中的数据和类型。Derived classes can choose what data and type to store in this indexer. 通常，这是作为 实现的，后者是对侦听器的弱引用的列表。Typically this is implemented as a , which is a list of weak references to listeners. 如果 类型不能包含所需的信息，则只需更改此类型。You would only have to change this type if the type cannot contain your required information. 如果是这样，则必须重写 方法，以便正确执行基础类型的所有清理操作。If so, you will have to override the method so that all cleanup of the underlying type is performed correctly.

summary.span: 将提供的侦听器添加到为托管事件所提供的源中。

span.span: Adds the provided listener to the provided source for the event being managed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在管理器类中调用此方法，`AddListener` 实现中的方法。Call this method within your manager class `AddListener` methods on implementations. `AddListener` 是你在管理器类上定义的静态方法的建议名称，可让其他类添加弱事件模式的侦听器。`AddListener` is the suggested name for the static method you define on your manager class to enable other classes to add a listener for your weak event pattern. `AddListener` 应采用以下两个参数：侦听器附加到的 `source` 和 `listener` 的实例。`AddListener` should take two parameters: the `source` where the listener is attached, and the `listener` instance. 对于 `AddListener` 实现，请对当前管理器调用 方法并传递相同的两个参数。For your `AddListener` implementation, call the method on the current manager and pass the same two parameters. 如果侦听器列表之前为空，则 在内部调用 方法，这将通过多态性调用特定 重写。If the list of listeners was previously empty, calls the method internally, which will call your specific override through polymorphism. 将侦听器添加到每个 `source`的单个内部 。 adds listeners to a single internal per `source`. 如果经理实现为每个事件源组合维护多个侦听器列表，请不要使用 。If your manager implementation maintains more than one list of listeners for each event-source combination, do not use . 相反，您的实现应创建自己的 实例，`AddListener` 应将侦听器添加到相应的列表，并且应通过调用 事件而不是 方法将事件传递到适当的侦听器列表。Instead, your implementation should create its own instances, `AddListener` should add listeners to the appropriate list, and events should be delivered to the appropriate listener list by calling the event instead of the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在管理器类中调用此方法，`RemoveListener` 实现中的方法。Call this method within your manager class `RemoveListener` methods on implementations. `RemoveListener` 是你在管理器类上定义的静态方法的建议名称，可让其他类删除弱事件模式的侦听器。`RemoveListener` is the suggested name for the static method you define on your manager class to enable other classes to remove a listener for your weak event pattern. `RemoveListener` 应采用以下两个参数：删除侦听器的 `source` 和 `listener` 类。`RemoveListener` should take two parameters: the `source` where the listener is removed, and the `listener` class. 对于 `RemoveListener` 实现，请对当前管理器调用 方法并传递相同的两个参数。For your `RemoveListener` implementation, call the method on the current manager and pass the same two parameters. 如果对 的调用会删除列表中的最后一个侦听器， 会在内部调用 方法，这将通过多态性调用特定的 重写。If a call to removes the last listener in the list, calls the method internally, which will call your specific override through polymorphism. 从每个 `source`的单个内部 中删除侦听器。 removes listeners from a single internal per `source`. 如果经理实现为每个事件源组合维护多个侦听器列表，请不要使用 。If your manager implementation maintains more than one list of listeners for each event-source combination, do not use . 相反，您的实现应创建自己的 实例，`RemoveListener` 应从相应的列表中移除侦听器，并通过调用 方法（而不是 方法）将事件传递到适当的侦听器列表。Instead, your implementation should create its own instances, `RemoveListener` should remove listeners from the appropriate list, and events should be delivered to the appropriate listener list by calling the method instead of the method.

summary.span: 在基础数据表上建立读取锁定，并返回 。

span.span: Establishes a read-lock on the underlying data table, and returns an .

value.span: 一个对象，可用于在数据表成员上建立锁定，然后通过 构造被相应释放。

span.span: An object that can be used to establish a lock on the data table members and then be appropriately disposed with a construct.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在派生类中，对 中包含的表的查询应始终出现在 `using (ReadLock) { ... }` 子句中，但已在写入锁定中的查询除外。In derived classes, queries to the table contained in should always occur within a `using (ReadLock) { ... }` clause, except for queries that are already within a write lock. 如果你的类支持更复杂的 `AddListener` 实现（需要超出 `source` 和 `listener`的数据），则可能需要执行这些查询，并使用 集合来存储额外的信息。These queries may be necessary if your class supports a more sophisticated `AddListener` implementation that requires more data beyond the `source` and the `listener`, and uses the collection to store the extra information.

summary.span: 要求在优先级较低的线程上清除基础侦听器列表中未使用的项。

span.span: Requests that a purge of unused entries in the underlying listener list be performed on a lower priority thread.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用 方法类似于在当前管理器的列表中以较低的线程优先级调用 方法，并将 `purgeAll` 参数设置为 `false`。Calling the method is similar to calling the method on the current manager's list, at lower thread priority, with the `purgeAll` parameter set to `false`.

para.span: 实现应移除 方法添加的类处理程序。

span.span: implementations should remove the class handler as added by the method.

para.span: 删除侦听器不应清除侦听器列表。

span.span: Removing a listener should not clear the listener list.

para.span: 相反，它只应断开类处理程序的连接（可能暂时会断开）。

span.span: Instead, it should only disconnect the class handler (perhaps temporarily).

span.span: Establishes a write-lock on the underlying data table, and returns an .

value.span: 一个对象，可用于在数据表成员上建立锁定，然后通过 构造被相应释放。

span.span: An object that can be used to establish a lock on the data table members and then be appropriately disposed with a construct.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在派生类中，对基础数据表的所有修改都应在 `using (WriteLock) { ... }` 子句中进行。In derived classes, all modifications to the underlying data table should occur within a `using (WriteLock) { ... }` clause. 如果你的类支持更复杂的 `AddListener` 实现（需要超出 `source` 和 `listener`的数据），则可能需要进行这些修改，并使用 集合来存储额外的信息。These modifications may be necessary if your class supports a more sophisticated `AddListener` implementation that requires more data beyond the `source` and the `listener`, and uses the collection to store the extra information.
